org.ambraproject.rhino.content.xml

Class AbstractArticleXml<T extends org.ambraproject.models.AmbraEntity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ambraproject.rhino.content.xml.AbstractXpathReader
      • org.ambraproject.rhino.content.xml.AbstractArticleXml<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of entity that can be build from this XML element
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArticleXml, AssetXml, CitedArticleXml

    public abstract class AbstractArticleXml<T extends org.ambraproject.models.AmbraEntity>
extends AbstractXpathReader
    A holder for a piece (node or document) of NLM-format XML, which can be built into an entity.

        Build an object from the XML supplied to this object.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the same object with values inserted

        XmlContentException - if the supplied XML omits a required element or does not have the expected structure

      • getTextFromNode

        protected String getTextFromNode(Node node)
        Description copied from class: AbstractXpathReader
        Define default text formatting for this object. By default, just calls Node.getTextContent(). Override for something different. Returns null on null input.
        Overrides:
        getTextFromNode in class AbstractXpathReader
        Parameters:
        node - an XML node
        Returns:
        the node's text content with optional formatting

      • parsePersonName

        protected PersonName parsePersonName(Node nameNode)
                              throws XmlContentException
        Parse a person's name from an article XML node. The returned object is useful for populating a ArticlePerson or CitedArticlePerson.

        This method expects to find a "name-style" attribute and "surname" subnode. The "given-names" and "suffix" subnodes are optional. Omitted nodes are represented by an empty string.

        Parameters:
        nameNode - the node to parse
        Returns:
        the name
        Throws:
        XmlContentException - if an expected field is omitted

      • uriEncode

        public static String uriEncode(String s)
        Encodes a string according to the URI escaping rules as described in section 2 of RFC 3986.

      • buildTextWithMarkup

        protected static String buildTextWithMarkup(Node node)
        Build a text field by partially reconstructing the node's content as XML. The output is text content between the node's two tags, including nested XML tags with attributes, but not this node's outer tags. Continuous substrings of whitespace may be substituted with other whitespace. Markup characters are escaped.

        This method is used instead of an appropriate XML library in order to match the behavior of legacy code, for now.

        Parameters:
        node - the node containing the text we are retrieving
        Returns:
        the marked-up node contents
